field.value: Exception thrown when accessing index of object returned from property.

field.name: description
field.value:
When trying to access an index of the value returned from a property, the following exception is thrown..
System.Reflection.TargetParameterCountException: Parameter count mismatch. Source File: c:\svn\Castle\trunk\MonoRail\Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail\ExpandDuckTypedExpressions_WorkaroundForDuplicateVirtualMethods.cs Line: 247
---
Code to reproduce...
public class Container { public string[] array = new string[] {"one", "two", "three"};
public string[] Array { get { return array; } } }
Controller:
public void Action() { Container container = new Container(); PropertyBag["Container"] = new Container(); }
Brail:
${Container.Array[0]}
-----
Other notes:
- The exception also happens with IList's and IDictionary's, and I'm assuming any other indexable object. - This only happens with properties, changing the Array property to a GetArray() function will not cause an exception.
